A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: It's official. From here on out\, Star Wars is about quantity over quality.  It's about telling you the story instead of SHOWING you the story.  It's about hyperspeed pacing so that they can cram in as many plotlines and subsequent random action scenes as possible as opposed to taking their time with character development\, relationship building\, story creation\, and providing audience contemplation.  I feel like this movie (and I will say\, many movies that are created today) caters to the people with supposed 6-second attention spans and a love for mindless entertainment\, which is really unfortunate.  I love movies that have depth\, heart\, and soul.  With the original Star Wars trilogy I got that but now\, I guess\, the old ways of filmmaking are being burned alongside the old Jedi textbooks.  Sad...
